sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of triangles using trigonometry
message_1: A triangular garden has sides 8m, 10m and 12m. Find the perimeter of the garden using trigonometry.
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the triangular garden, we simply need to add the lengths of all three sides. In this case, we don't actually need to use trigonometry, as the problem can be solved using basic arithmetic.

Perimeter = Side 1 + Side 2 + Side 3
Perimeter = 8m + 10m + 12m
Perimeter = 30m

The perimeter of the triangular garden is 30 meters.
